page.title: 05CARR SIDE FARM-INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: Carr Side farm includes the fields and some woodland inside the park wall and extends from there to the south bank of the River Alt. The cereal crops on the farm, at the time of survey, June-July, were wheat and barley.The root crops were patatoes and sugar,beet.One field was in grass and ready for cutting. This would would be baled and kept for winter feed. There are 200 cattle kept for beef,mainly Charolais and crosses. most of the cattle are bought at 12-14 weeks and fed on barley until about 10 months when they are sent to market. The bullocks weigh about 500kg at 11-12 months.35 cows are kept for breeding. Most of the barley is grown for animal feed. The sugar beet is sold for refining.
